sentences: Eddie Daniels (born October 19, 1941) is an American musician and composer.
Daniels was born in New York City to a Jewish family.
His mother emigrated from Romania.
He was raised in the Manhattan Beach neighborhood of Brooklyn in New York City.
DownBeat gave Daniels the New Star on Clarinet Award in 1968.
He was a member for six years of The Thad Jones/Mel Lewis Orchestra, playing tenor saxophone, clarinet and flute.
On the album "Presenting Joe Williams and the Thad Jones/Mel Lewis Jazz Orchestra", his solo on "Evil Man Blues" was mistakenly credited to his colleague Joe Farrell.
In 1989, he won a Grammy Award for his contribution to the Roger Kellaway arrangement of "Memos from Paradise".
In 2009, Swiss composer and saxophonist Daniel Schnyder composed MATRIX 21, a Concerto for Clarinet and Orchestra, for Daniels and dedicated it to him.
It was commissioned by the Orchestre de Chambre de Lausanne (Switzerland) and world-premiered in Lausanne under its artistic director Christian Zacharias in January 2010.
The American premiere took place at the Crested Butte Music Festival on July 18, 2010, under the direction of music director Jens Georg Bachmann.
